content:
TITLE: Installing OctoBot Using Docker
DESCRIPTION: A Docker command to install and run OctoBot. This command runs OctoBot in detached mode, exposes it on port 80, and mounts volumes for user data, tentacles, and logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -itd --name OctoBot -p 80:5001 -v $(pwd)/user:/octobot/user -v $(pwd)/tentacles:/octobot/tentacles -v $(pwd)/logs:/octobot/logs drakkarsoftware/octobot:stable
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Drakkar-Software Dependencies for OctoBot
DESCRIPTION: Lists the core Drakkar-Software package dependencies with specific version numbers required for OctoBot functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
OctoBot-Commons==1.9.74
OctoBot-Trading==2.4.170
OctoBot-Evaluators==1.9.7
OctoBot-Tentacles-Manager==2.9.16
OctoBot-Services==1.6.23
OctoBot-Backtesting==1.9.7
Async-Channel==2.2.1
trading-backend==1.2.38
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Contribution Guidelines in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides instructions for contributing to OctoBot, including where to create pull requests, requirements for new features, and specific coding style guidelines.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
# Contribute to OctoBot

Feel like OctoBot is missing a feature? We welcome your pull requests! 

Few pointers for contributions:

- Create your PR against the dev branch, not master.
- New features need to contain unit tests and must be PEP8 compliant (max-line-length = 100).
    
# OctoBot additional coding style

- Use local variable only if it improves code clarity
- Always use comprehension list
- Use `try ... except` instead of `if` statetements when `if` is 99% `True`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Test Dependencies for OctoBot Project
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the Python packages required for testing the OctoBot project. It includes pytest and related plugins for testing, mock for creating test doubles, coverage tools, packaging utilities, and pylint for code quality checks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/dev_requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
pytest>=7.1
pytest-asyncio>=0.19
pytest-cov
pytest-timeout

mock>=4.0.1

coverage
coveralls

twine
pip
setuptools
wheel

pur

pylint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Additional Dependencies for OctoBot
DESCRIPTION: Lists additional Python package dependencies with version numbers, including common utilities and libraries used in the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
colorlog==6.8.0
requests==2.32.3
urllib3 # required by requests, used in imports: make sure it's always available
packaging==23.2
python-dotenv==1.0.0
setuptools==69.0.3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Async HTTP Request Dependencies for OctoBot
DESCRIPTION: Lists async HTTP request-related Python package dependencies with version numbers, including a note about compatibility issues with aiodns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
aiohttp==3.10.4
# updating to aiodns==3.2.0 is incompatible (and failing CI)
# raises RuntimeError: aiodns needs a SelectorEventLoop on Windows. See more: https://github.com/saghul/aiodns/issues/86
aiodns==3.1.1   # used by aiohttp
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Version Numbers for Octobot Release
DESCRIPTION: File locations and variables to update when creating a new Octobot release. This applies to minor, major, and development stage releases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/DELIVERY.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
- *config/cst.py*   --> MINOR_VERSION
- *README.md*       --> OctoBot [R.D.MA_MI]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Community Dependencies for OctoBot
DESCRIPTION: Lists community-related Python package dependencies, including websockets and encryption libraries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
websockets
gmqtt==0.7.0
pgpy==0.6.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Supabase-related Dependencies for OctoBot
DESCRIPTION: Lists Supabase-related Python package dependencies with specific version numbers, ensuring compatibility with backend tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
supabase==2.13.0   # Supabase client
gotrue     # Supabase authenticated API (required by supabase and enforced to allow direct import)
postgrest  # Supabase posgres calls (required by supabase and enforced to allow direct import)
gotrue==2.11.3
storage3==0.11.3
supafunc==0.9.3
postgrest==0.19.3
realtime==2.0.2 # can't use a higher version as long as aiohttp==3.10.4 is enforced (requires aiohttp>=3.10.10)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Git Tag for Octobot Version
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create and push a Git tag for an Octobot version. The tag follows the long version structure format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/DELIVERY.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git tag R.D.MA_MI-D_LONG
git push --tags
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Error Tracking Dependency for OctoBot
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the Sentry SDK version for error tracking, with a note to ensure compatibility with a specific module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
sentry-sdk==2.20.0  # always make sure sentry_aiohttp_transport.py keep working
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing New Features in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list new features using Markdown bullet points.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# New features :
    - Requirement cleanup
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Issues in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to list addressed issues using Markdown bullet points with issue numbers and descriptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Concerned issues :
    #624 fixed offline announcements
    #629 fixed real trader multiple stop orders
    #631 fixed dusts management round system
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Bug Fixes in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to list bug fixes using Markdown bullet points.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Bug fixes :
    - Fix pip delivery
    - Fix real trader stop orders
    - Fix dusts management
    - Minor fixes on portfolio
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Changelog Header in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to format a changelog header with version number and release date using Markdown syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/drakkar-software/octobot/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
Changelog for 0.3.1-beta
====================
*Released date : January 29 2019*
```
